title: As a proud homosexual
body:

replies.body:
You know the easiest way to avoid prejudice online?

Just don't bring it up in the first place.

I don't join a game and say "I'm a straight white male with no religious affiliation".

It's not that people are actually homophobic, racist, anti-whatever religion you might be, it's the internet so people like to be contrary.
I could say something like "I like dogs", and I know someone is going to reply with "you're stupid, cats are better" or some bestiality comment, because that's just how the internet is.

Don't bring up your sexuality and no one will make fun of it.
I don't go around screaming "I like big titties!", so why do others have to tell me they like penis?

It's the same with the whole "i'm a girl" thing that people do, no one fucking cares, it's the internet, and we hate you for being you, regardless of sex/sexual preference, don't bring it up, don't get ridiculed, if you feel the need to bring it up every game, unbind your fucking enter key.

Yeah its as as simple as that. Even if you say "Im a christian" you would get just as much hate.  The unbind your enter key is gold man,do it.

Hey man, it's unfortunate that you've had a bad experience with this. Riot has a 0 tolerance of homophobia, so if this is genuine hate for gay people then they will take action against it, and so they should! That behaviour is unacceptable anywhere.

But everything has its time and place, you cant poke a bear and then complain about it mauling you. 
Even though the bear is in the wrong in this situation, you could have avoided the whole situation with some common sense.

Loading into game and announcing to the world your sexuality without provocation, is just not a normal thing to do. Sure you do _(and should)_ have the right to, theres nothing wrong with your sexuality. But regardless of what team you play for, that behaviour is just neither relevant, nor appropriate for the situation.

For example, there is nothing wrong with gaming, we are all gamers here and that doesn't make us any less of a person. However if I walk into a club, sit down next to a pretty girl and say _"Yo. you ever heard of Azeroth? Im a mage!"_ I will not be leaving with a pretty girl on my arm. Does that make gaming wrong? No, but it is inappropriate for the situation.

Theres a time and a place for everything, and in league people come to have fun, they don't want whatever baggage you have regarding your sexuality. So when you proudly announce it to them, they probably will react badly, not because they disapprove of your sexuality, but because they just want to play a game without someone shoving it in their face.

I personally don't see the need to be all proud and showy about it? Why do you need a flag? Im straight, Im not necessarily proud of it, it's not an achievement or anything, it's just the way I am, I accept it and get on with my life. I fail to see how gay people are any different. Why do you feel the need to tell everyone? I don't announce my sexual/political/religions preferences whenever I start a game.

Im pretty sure it'd be a hate crime if there was a straight pride flag.
How's that for equality?
_____________

What I'm trying to say here, is that theres nothing wrong at all with being gay, but it is irritating when someone shoves their beliefs or baggage on you, thats why Jehovah's witnesses aren't popular, its not that people don't like the religion, people just don't like randoms showing up in their private space and preaching about how you're wrong.

So if you want to just have en enjoyable game of league, play league, no need to bring anything else into it. Thats what we are all here for after all.

Niji, I don't hate you for being gay, I just dislike you for your attitude.

Assholes are assholes, regardless of sexuality, race, religion, etc.

If I pretended an asshole wasn't an asshole, just because they are gay/black/Muslim/whatever, that would make me an asshole.
